Description: Knight Securities, L.P. agreed to pay $66.5 to settle SEC allegations that it defrauded its institutional customers by extracting excessive profits out of its customers' orders while failing to meet the firm's duty to provide best execution to the institutions that placed those orders.

NASD found that Knight's former leading institutional sales trader priced trades in a manner contrary to customers' expectations and industry custom, using deceptive trading practices to disguise his pricing and the amount of Knight's profits. The NASD fine was part of a larger settlement involving the SEC; see https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-knight-securities-lp
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government. This case was handled by its predecessor, the National Association of Securities Dealers (NASD).

Description: NASD Regulation, Inc., announced that Knight Securities L.P., had been censured, fined $700,000 and directed to pay $800,000 to clients of the firm. The sanctions were imposed for wide-ranging market making and trading violations, including failure to honor posted quotes and to accurately report trades to the NASD.
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government. This case was handled by its predecessor, the National Association of Securities Dealers (NASD).
